data_findings.finding: This is a 2D polygon packing problem: pack N Christmas tree shapes (15-vertex polygons) into smallest square bounding box for N=1 to 200. Score = sum(side^2/N). Lower is better. Target: 68.894234

Key approaches: 1) Greedy placement with collision detection (baseline), 2) Simulated annealing (SA), 3) bbox3 C++ optimizer with complex number coordinates, 4) shake_public optimizer, 5) Rotation tightening to minimize bounding box, 6) Lattice/tessellation patterns for larger N

Discussion topics suggest: Asymmetric solutions outperform symmetric ones (38 votes), Symmetric solutions that are apparently optimal (43 votes), Per-N optimization is critical. Tools: bbox3, shake_public binaries for optimization.
